result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A Singer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: 15CF980

superMiscConds.notes:
BAIL APPLIED TO ALL COSTS.
$1,192.80 was extradition costs that will be forwarded to the Waukesha Sheriff's Dept.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Attend Victim Impact Panel during Extended Supervision.
Do not drive/operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Provide DNA Sample if not previously done.

records.addlTxt: 6/12/17 Letter from Defendant regarding sentence credit

The Court has reviewed the Defendant's pro se letter.  The restitution figure was set as a result of a hearing that the Defendant participated in.  The additional sentence credit has now been reflected on an amended Judgment of Conviction.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jacob A Singer in court, in custody, with attorney Robert Buckett.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for restitution hearing on 15CF1231 and 15CF980. As to 15CF980, parties stipulate to the the amounts owed, but the defense does argue as to how the defendant can pay the amound that is owed. State presents arguments. Court does award the restitution amount of $317,469.94 to Rural Mutual Insurance and $16,517.39 to the victim and the victim is to be paid 1st. Apply the remaining bail towards the restitution that is owed to the victim.  Court further orders that 25% of defendant's prison wages only are to be paid towards the restitution amounts. Defendant is further ordered 31 more days of credit toward his sentence. Restitution remains as set on 15CF1231. Defendant can be returned forthwith.
filed, to be produced from Dodge Correctional Inst.
dated 4/7/16 filed by Attorney Buckett advising defendant is not challenging extradition costs in this case
Restitution hearing at 05-06-2016 09:30 am
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-29-2016 03:00 pm
